alert.note: Alert for Pondera; Teton (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 23 at 6:36PM MDT until June 23 at 8:30PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Pondera County in north central Montana... Eastern Teton County in north central Montana... * Until 830 PM MDT. * At 636 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Brady, Power and Collins. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
